module.name: ActnList
module.short: Defines classes for Actions and lists of Actions for use in LCL components.

descr.p: actnlist.pas contains classes which implements actions used in LCL components. The following components are added to the Lazarus IDE component palette:
Standard Tab
Registered but not displayed:

element.name: TContainedAction
element.short: Implements an Action class which has a category and parent action list.

descr.p: TContainedAction is a TBasicAction descendant which allows an action to be given a category, and grouped with related actions. It provides additional properties and methods used to assign an action to the category and an associated list of actions. These values are used at design-time in the Action List editor.
TContainedAction is the ancestor for the TCustomAction class.

element.name: TContainedAction.ReadState
element.short: Reads properties and child components for the class instance.

descr.p: ReadState is an overridden method in TContainedAction used to read values for the class instance during LCL component streaming. It calls the inherited method to read properties and child components using the specified TReader class instance. When the Parent in Reader is a TCustomActionList instance, it is stored in the ActionList property.

element.name: TContainedAction.ReadState.Reader
element.short: TReader instance used to read values for the component.

element.name: TContainedAction.SetParentComponent
element.short: Sets the parent component for the class instance.

descr.p: SetParentComponent is an overridden method used to set the property in the class instance which contains the parent component. It re-implements the method from the ancestor class.
In TContainedAction, it sets the ActionList property to the value in AParent when AParent is derived from TCustomActionList.

element.name: TContainedAction.SetParentComponent.AParent
element.short: Value assigned to the parent component for the class.

element.name: TContainedAction.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. When ActionList has been assigned, its RemoveAction method is called to delete the current class instance.
Destroy calls the inherited method to free the class instance and unregister any action link clients.

element.name: TContainedAction.Execute
element.short: Executes the action using a available OnExecute event handler.

descr.p: Execute is an overridden method in TContainedAction. It checks for an available OnExecute event handlers in ActionList, the Application singleton, and the class instance. If an OnExecute event handler is not found, it posts a CM_ACTIONEXECUTE control message to the application.

element.name: TContainedAction.Execute.Result
element.short: True if the action was executed using one of the available execution options.

element.name: TContainedAction.GetParentComponent
element.short: Gets the parent component for the class instance.

descr.p: GetParentComponent is an overridden method used to get the property in the class instance which is the parent component for the class instance. It re-implements the method from the ancestor class.
In TContainedAction, it gets the value in the ActionList property (when assigned) or calls the inherited method.

element.name: TContainedAction.GetParentComponent.Result
element.short: Parent component for the class instance, or Nil when not assigned.

element.name: TContainedAction.HasParent
element.short: Indicates if a value has been assigned to the property with the parent component for the class instance.

descr.p: HasParent is an overridden method in TContainedAction. It checks for an assigned value in the ActionList property, and sets the return value to True when assigned. Otherwise, the inherited method is called to get the return value.

element.name: TContainedAction.HasParent.Result
element.short: True when the parent component has been assigned.

element.name: TContainedAction.Update
element.short: Signals an available OnUpdate event handler to update values in the Action.

element.name: TContainedAction.Update.Result
element.short: True if an OnUpdate event handler was found and executed for the Action.

element.name: TContainedAction.ActionList
element.short: The ActionList where the action is stored, and its parent component.

element.name: TContainedAction.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the action in ActionList.

element.name: TContainedAction.Category
element.short: The Category of this action.

element.name: TContainedActionClass
element.short: Class type for TContainedAction instances.

element.name: TActionListEnumerator
element.short: Implements an enumerator for the Actions in TCustomActionList.

descr.p: TActionListEnumerator implements an enumerator for TContainedAction values stored in TCustomActionList. It allows navigation of values in the Actions property using the "for .. in" loop syntax. TActionListEnumerator is the type returned from the TCustomActionList.GetEnumerator method.

element.name: TActionListEnumerator.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Stores the value passed in AList to the member variable for the Actions property. Sets the value for the internal position member to -1.

element.name: TActionListEnumerator.Create.AList
element.short: Action list with the values for the enumerator.

element.name: TActionListEnumerator.MoveNext
element.short: Moves to the next value for the enumerator.

element.name: TActionListEnumerator.MoveNext.Result
element.short: True if the next value was available. False when no more values exist for the enumerator.

element.name: TActionListEnumerator.Current
element.short: Current value for the enumerator.

descr.p: Current is a read-only TContainedAction property with the current value for the enumerator. The property value is retrieved from Actions using the position in an internal member.

element.name: TActionEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled to implement an action in TCustomActionList.

descr.p: Arguments passed to the event handler include the Action for the notification and a return value that indicates if the action was executed.
TActionEvent is the type used for the OnExecute and OnUpdate properties in TCustomActionList.

element.name: TActionEvent.Action
element.short: TBasicAction for the event notification.

element.name: TActionEvent.Handled
element.short: True if the action was executed in the action list for t he handler.

element.name: TActionListState
element.short: Represents state values for an action list.

descr.p: TActionListState is the type used for the State property in TCustomActionList.

element.name: TActionListState.asNormal
element.short: The action list is enabled, and can update and execute its actions.

element.name: TActionListState.asSuspended
element.short: The action list is disabled, and the Enabled state for its actions is ignored.

element.name: TActionListState.asSuspendedEnabled
element.short: The action list is disabled, but the Enabled state for its actions is set to True.

element.name: TCustomActionList
element.short: TCustomActionList - the ancestor class for TActionList.

descr.p: TCustomActionList - the ancestor class for TActionList. If you want to define your own action list class, you should derive it from this class.

TActionList, TAction, TActionLink and TContainedAction are used to centralize the implementation of user commands, and can then be linked to the appropriate button, menu or another component. This is an Object-Oriented programming strategy to reuse the code, as opposed to the Event-Oriented approach of writing an OnClick event for each component.

element.name: TCustomActionList.AddAction
element.short: Adds the specified action to the action list.

descr.p: Sets the parent component for the action, and adds the value to the internal list for the component. Raises an Exception if the Action has already been added to the action list.

element.name: TCustomActionList.RemoveAction

element.name: TCustomActionList.RemoveAction.Action

element.name: TCustomActionList.Change
element.short: Performs action needed when the action list or one of its Actions has been changed.

descr.p: Change signals the OnChange event handler (when assigned) to perform user-specified operations for the action list. Change also visits each of the Actions in the action list, and calls its Change method to signal the OnChange event handler supplied at the action level. It calls the OwnerFormDesignerModified routine at design-time to notify the form designer of the change to the action list.
Change is called when a new TCustomImageList value is assigned to the Images property in the action list.

element.name: TCustomActionList.SetChildOrder
element.short: Set the order for the specified child (Action).

descr.p: SetChildOrder is an overridden method in TCustomActionList. It sets the ordinal position for the action in Component to the value specified in Order. The IndexOf method in Actions is called to get the current position for Component. The value in Order is assigned to the Index property in the TContainedAction when it exists in Actions. No actions are performed in the method when Component is not stored in the Actions for the action list.

element.name: TCustomActionList.SetChildOrder.Component
element.short: Child component (action) re-order in the method.

element.name: TCustomActionList.SetChildOrder.Order
element.short: New position in the Actions list.

element.short: Sets the value for the Images property.

element.short: New value for the Images property.

element.name: TCustomActionList.OnChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when the action list has been changed.

element.short: OnExecute - event handler for execution of the action.

element.name: TCustomActionList.OnUpdate
element.short: OnUpdate - event handler for updating the action.

element.name: TCustomActionList.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TCustomActionList, and calls the inherited constructor.
Create allocates resources needed for members in the class instance, and assigns the OnChange event handler used in the internal TChangeLink instance when the Images property is altered.
Create sets the default value in the State property to asNormal.

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for TCustomActionList. It frees the internal TChangeLink instance used in the class, frees any class instance and resources allocated to the Actions property.
Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TCustomActionList.ActionByName

element.name: TCustomActionList.ExecuteAction

descr.p: ExecuteAction checks whether Action handles the current component, and if yes, calls the ExecuteAction method, passing itself as a parameter. The function returns True if the action handles the current component.

element.name: TCustomActionList.UpdateAction
element.short: Examines and updates the target for the specified Action.

descr.p: UpdateAction checks whether Action handles the current component, and if yes, calls the UpdateTarget method, passing itself as a parameter. The function returns True if the action handles the current component.

element.name: TActionList
element.short: TActionList - The basic actions list class.

descr.p: TActionList - The basic actions list class. TActionList is the last component on the "Standard" component palette on the Lazarus IDE.

To use an ActionList, click on the icon on the IDE Standard Components toolbar, then click anywhere on the main form and an ActionList icon will appear. It does not matter where you position it, because it is not visible at run-time.

You can add, remove or modify actions on the list by right-clicking on the ActionList icon on the form editor and then choosing "Edit action list...", or by double-clicking on the icon with the left mouse button. This will open the "Action List Editor".

You can now use the "+" and "-" buttons to add and remove actions. The ActionList editor menu allows you to select standard actions from a selection (option 'New Standard Action') or create a new action (option 'New Action'). To edit an action, click it and then open the object inspector. To add code to be executed when an action is triggered, double-click the action's name on the "Action List Editor".

The TActionList class introduces very few properties of its own, but inherits a lot from its ancestor, TCustomActionList, and related components TAction, TCustomAction, TContainedAction and TBasicAction.
Each entry in the ActionList appears in the Object Inspector as an instance of TAction, and its properties are accessible and modifiable from the Object Inspector.

element.name: TCustomAction
element.short: TCustomAction is the ancestor class for TAction.

descr.p: TCustomAction is a generic class for all components that represent actions that can be be set on the user interface for buttons and other controls. TCustomAction is the ancestor for TAction. If you want to define your own action class, you should derive it from this class.
You can assign a action to a component by using the Object Inspector.

element.name: TCustomAction.AssignTo
element.short: Copies property from the class instance to the specified persistent object.

descr.p: AssignTo is the generic function to assign the class' contents to another class. This method must be overridden by descendent classes to actually assign the content of the source instance to the destination instance.

The implementation of Assignto raises an EConvertError exception. This is done for the following reason: If the source class doesn't know how to assign itself to the destination class (using AssignTo), the destination class may know how get the data from the source class (using Assign). If all descendent methods are implemented correctly, then if neither of the two classes knows how to assign their contents to each other, execution will end up at , which will simply execute.
If neither of the classes knows how to assign to/from each other, then execution will end up at the TPersistent implementation of AssignTo, and an exception will be raised.

element.errors: Raises an EConvertError exception if the current class cannot be assigned to the persistent class instance in Dest.

Execute calls Update to signal an available OnUpdate event handler in the ActionList, the Application singleton, or the class instance. It toggles the value in the Checked property when AutoCheck is enabled. The inherited Execute method is called when the class instance is Enabled.
The return value is True if the action was executed in the method.

element.name: TAction
element.short: TAction is the basic action object used on the LCL.

descr.p: TAction is the basic action object used on the LCL.
It redeclares many properties inherited from TCustomAction on the public section, but does not add any new features. For more details look at the See Also section for TCustomAction.
The properties of each Action can be modified at design time in the Object Inspector.

element.name: TAction.OnExecute
element.short: Event called when action is executed.

descr.p: OnExecute is the event triggered when the action is activated (executed). The event is triggered e.g. when the user clicks e.g. on a menu item or a button associated to the action. The application programmer should provide a OnExecute event handler to execute whatever code is necessary when the button is pressed or the menu item is chosen.

Note that assigning an OnExecute handler will result in the Execute method returning a True value. Predefined actions (such as dataset actions) will check the result of Execute and will not perform their normal task if the OnExecute handler was called.

Since version 1.1 setting OnExecute no longer sets the owner's OnClick. You can now specify an event for the action and a more specific OnClick for control and both are called. OnClick is called before OnExecute.

element.name: TAction.OnUpdate
element.short: Event handler signalled to update an action when the application is idle.

descr.p: OnUpdate is the event triggered when the application is idle, and the action is being updated. The OnUpdate event can be used to set the state of the action, for instance disable it if the action cannot be executed at this point in time.
